business.headline: Sensex, Nifty rise despite Israel-Iran tensions. What's fuelling today's rally?On Monday morning, both benchmark indices opened firm despite geopolitical concerns, with the BSE Sensex rising 170.94 points to 81,289.54 and the NSE Nifty50 gaining 62.90 points to trade at 24,781.50 as of 10:19 am.

Foxconn ships 97% of India-made iPhones to US to dodge Trump's China tariffsThe numbers show that Apple has shifted its export focus from a mix of countries to mainly serving the U.S. market. Earlier, Indian exports were sent to places like the Netherlands, the Czech Republic, and the UK.

Tata Motors shares sink over 5% today. What's behind the sharp decline?The decline was primarily driven by a downward revision in Jaguar Land Rover's (JLR) earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT) margin forecast for the fiscal year 2026.

Gold price rises amid Israel-Iran tensions: Should you buy now or wait?Gold prices are rising again as global tensions heat up and markets turn cautious. With rates inching higher, should you be buying gold or waiting it out?
Sensex, Nifty open higher as IT stocks rally amid Israel-Iran conflictThe S&P BSE Sensex was up by 257.49 points to 81,376.09, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 83.20 points to 24,803.55 as of 9:29 am.

DLF set to invest Rs 5,500 crore to build luxury housing project in GurugramDLF has seen significant sales momentum in Gurugram, where its previous projects have sold out rapidly. Privana South, launched in January 2024, saw all 1,113 apartments sold in just three days, generating Rs 7,200 crore.

Stock market opening today: Will Sensex, Nifty crash again on June 16?Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) have maintained their selling stance for a third consecutive session, resulting in net outflows of Rs 54,020 crore in June alone. Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) have continued their buying spree.

Stocks to watch on June 16: Adani Enterprises, Sun Pharma, NTPC, Bajaj FinanceAs trading resumes on Monday, shares of several companies will be in focus due to fresh developments. These include Adani Enterprises, Sun Pharma, NTPC, Bajaj Finance, Vedanta, and others.

Advance tax alert: First instalment due by June 15, find out if you are liableAdvance tax simply means paying your income tax in parts throughout the year, instead of waiting till the end. If your total tax due for the year is more than Rs 10,000, then you must pay it in advance in four instalments.
Iran-Israel tensions rise. Why India should worryThe escalating Iran-Israel conflict poses significant challenges for India, particularly concerning oil imports and economic stability.

Sensex settles 573 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; Adani Ports falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 573.38 points to end at 81,118.60, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 169.60 points to close at 24,718.60.

Gold prices rise sharply amid Israel-Iran tensions in IndiaThe rise in gold prices is being linked to worries over a possible wider conflict in the Middle East, which has made investors turn to gold as a safe place to park money.

entertainment.headline: Aamir Khan breaks silence on backlash over late response to Pahalgam terror attackActor Aamir Khan has responded to criticism over his delayed reaction to the Pahalgam terror attack, clarifying that it had nothing to do with promoting his upcoming film, 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. He explained that the delay was because he is not active on social media.

Singer Jonita recalls being tagged in obscene Instagram post, calls it harassmentSinger Jonita Gandhi revealed she was tagged in an explicit Instagram story featuring her photo in the background, calling it harassment. She said while she reports and blocks such users, she worries about her mother seeing such content on her profile.

Fatima Sana Shaikh clarifies remarks on casting couch: Not entire South industryActor Fatima Sana Shaikh clarified that her casting couch remark was about a specific incident and not a reflection of the entire South film industry. She said her words were taken out of context and unnecessarily blown out of proportion.

Priyanka Chopra shares Malti's cute nickname for Nick Jonas in Father's Day postPriyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas celebrated Father's Day with their daughter Malti Marie. Sharing a series of photos, the actor revealed Malti's adorable nickname to her father.

Kuberaa trailer: Dhanush, Nagarjuna's gripping film is battle between money, powerDirector Sekhar Kammula's 'Kuberaa' is a thrilling battle between money and power. While Dhanush plays a beggar who shakes the government, Nagarjuna will be seen as a powerful man with multiple shades.

Atlee on plagiarism amid AA22xA6-Dune poster row: Earned this only through honestyDirector Atlee recently addressed the allegations about his films being copied from other works. The filmmaker also shared his vision for Allu Arjun and Deepika Padukone's 'AA22xA6'.

Rishab Shetty and crew unhurt after boat capsizes during Kantara Chapter 1 shootA boat capsized during the shooting of actor-director Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' at Shivamogga's Mani reservoir. Shetty and the crew members escaped unharmed from the incident.

Actor Kushal Tandon confirms breakup with Shivangi Joshi in now-deleted postActor Kushal Tandon confirmed his breakup with 'Barsaatein' co-star Shivangi Joshi in a now-deleted post. Tandon shared that the two had parted ways five months back.

Anushka Sharma's Father's Day post is a letter from Vamika to Virat KohliActor Anushka Sharma shared a special handwritten note by her daughter, Vamika, for Virat Kohli. The special letter has left fans in awe.

Actor Unni Mukundan's Marco 2 dropped, actor says too much negativity'Marco' actor Unni Mukundan has dropped all plans to continue the film series. Citing 'negativity' around the project, the actor mentioned that he will not be a part of the sequel.

Sardaar Ji 3 teaser: Diljit Dosanjh returns as ghost hunter in hilarious avatarThe teaser of 'Sardaar Ji 3' starring Diljit Dosanjh and Neeru Bajwa is out. The film will release in theatres on June 27.

Pakeezah: A poignant reminder of Meena Kumari and India's poetic pastPakeezah (1972) is a nostalgic journey into a bygone India of thumris, shayari, and Nawabi grace. The film stars Meena Kumari as the eponymous lead, alongside Ashok Kumar and Raaj Kumar.

Actor Ankit Gupta addresses dating rumours, threatens legal actionActor Ankit Gupta recently addressed his link-up rumours amid breakup with Priyanka Chahar Choudhary. Gupta even vowed to take legal action against those spreading defamatory content.

Housefull 5 Box Office Day 9: Akshay Kumar's comedy holds strong in theatresAkshay Kumar's 'Housefull 5', which hit theatres on June 6, continues to perform well at the box office in its second week. The film has raked in an estimated Rs 142.25 crore in India so far.

Atlee gets honorary doctorate from Sathyabama University, gives emotional speechDirector Atlee recently received an honorary doctorate from Sathyabama Institute of Science and Technology. He was recognised for his valuable contributions to Indian cinema.

'Kannappa' trailer: Vishnu Manchu, Akshay Kumar bring powerful tale of devotionThe trailer of 'Kannappa' starring Vishnu Manchu, Akshay Kumar, Prabhas, and Mohanlal is out. The film is slated to hit the big screen on June 27.

Anirudh Ravichander quashes wedding reports: Stop spreading rumoursComposer Anirudh Ravichander has finally addressed the speculations about his alleged wedding with Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) owner Kavya Maran.

Dharmendra suggested Big B for Sholay, convinced Ramesh Sippy he'd be perfectVeteran actor Dharmendra opened up about recommending Amitabh Bachchan for the role of Jai in 'Sholay'. He reflected on Big B's impressive quality as a young actor in the 70s.

Diljit Dosanjh, Imtiaz Ali reunite for untitled film with Sharvari and Vedang RainaFilmmaker Imtiaz Ali is set to reunite with Diljit Dosanjh for their upcoming film. Set to begin filming in August 2025, this untitled film will hit theatres on Baisakhi 2026.

general news.headline: Iran says Pak will nuke Israel if it uses nuclear bomb on Tehran, Islamabad denies"Pakistan has told us that if Israel uses a nuclear bomb on Iran, then Pakistan will also attack Israel with a nuclear bomb," General Mohsen Rezaei, an IRGC commander and member of Iran's National Security Council, said on Iranian state television.

Please stop: Plane crash victim's cousin slams influencers for exploiting tragedyKuldeep Bhatt, the cousin of Komi Vyas, who perished in the Air India crash along with her husband and their three children, spoke out against the "mental trauma" being inflicted upon his family and the families of the 270 other victims by irresponsible online content.

Iran wants to kill Trump, plotted assassination: Netanyahu's explosive claimIsraeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu claimed that Iran's Islamic regime had plotted to assassinate US President Donald Trump, labelling him as enemy number one.

Bathtub, swimming pool found inside demolished illegal religious site in GujaratPolice in Gujarat's Jamnagar found a bathtub, a swimming room and spacious rooms during the demolition of an illegal religious site built in an area of about 11,000 square feet.
Israel-Iran war: The bleak choice before Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali KhameneiIran now stands exposed and vulnerable with Israeli jets flying with impunity from the Mediterranean to the Arabian Sea.

Cockpit Voice Recorder found from Air India plane crash siteOfficials confirmed the recovery of the Cockpit Voice Recorder found from the Air India plane crash site. The probe intensifies from the Air India crash site in Ahmedabad, aiding the ongoing probe into the tragedy that killed 270 people.

PM to arrive in Canada today for G7, Indian community hopes for better tiesPrime Minister Narendra Modi is set to arrive in Canada for the G7 Summit, marking his first visit since ties soured over the Nijjar row. The Indian community in Calgary are hopeful this visit will improve bilateral relations.

News Menu, June 16: PM Modi in Canada for G7; Iran-Israel war intensifiesIndia Today's June 16 news wrap captures global turbulence — from the Iran-Israel conflict and Modi's diplomatic tour to domestic tragedies including crashes, monsoon alerts.
No rings, no roles, no rules: The freedom of Relationship AnarchyInstead of assuming roles, Relationship Anarchy invites you to co-create relationships that fit the needs of the partners.

Aamir Khan breaks silence on backlash over late response to Pahalgam terror attackActor Aamir Khan has responded to criticism over his delayed reaction to the Pahalgam terror attack, clarifying that it had nothing to do with promoting his upcoming film, 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. He explained that the delay was because he is not active on social media.

Israel pounds Iran for third night, Tehran claims 224 killed, including generals Live Updates Israel and Iran traded fresh missile strikes overnight, with both sides reporting high casualties. Iran claimed key generals were killed, while Israel said over 270 missiles had been fired since Friday.

Don't watch such nonsense: Sonam told woman viewing Raja Raghuvanshi case reelsIn an interview with India Today TV, Ujala Yadav shared details of her brief encounter with Sonam Raghuvanshi on the night of June 8, just hours before her arrest in the Raja Raghuvanshi murder case.

Amid Israel-Iran conflict, India balances ties with both nations carefullyIndia balances strategic ties with both Israel and Iran amid rising tensions, focusing on diplomacy, defence interests, and regional stability while avoiding alignment with either side.

Live: US embassy closed after nearby Iranian strike in JerusalemIsrael Iran Conflict Live Updates: Israel continued its military strikes on Iran for a third straight day, targeting Tehran and other regions, killing 224 people, including Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) intelligence chief Mohammed Kazemi and two generals. Israel's airspace and airports were shut down. Army chief Eyal Zamir vowed to intensify the attacks against what he called an "existential threat".

AUS remain at the top of ICC Test rankings despite WTC loss to SADespite losing the World Test Championship final to South Africa, Australia maintained their lead in the latest update of the ICC Test team rankings with the Proteas jumping up to second in the charts.

Hajj flight faces wheel glitch at Lucknow airport; smoke, sparks seenA Saudia Airlines flight carrying Hajj pilgrims landed safely in Lucknow despite smoke and sparks from a wheel caused by a hydraulic leak. All 250 onboard were safely evacuated.

Canadian Grand Prix: George Russell wins from pole as Piastri and Norris collideGeorge Russell handed Mercedes its first win of the Formula One season with a composed drive at the Canadian Grand Prix on Sunday. The race also saw a major shift in the championship standings, as McLaren's Oscar Piastri moved 22 points clear at the top after teammate Lando Norris collided with him and was forced to retire.

Iran's revolutionary guards intel chief killed in Israeli strikeBrigadier General Mohammad Kazemi and his deputy Hassan Mohaqiq, top intelligence leaders of Iran's Revolutionary Guard, were killed in an Israeli airstrike in Tehran, confirmed by Prime Minister Netanyahu. This is part of Israel's intensified strikes to dismantle Iran's nuclear and missile programs.

Trump vetoed Israel's plan to assassinate Iran's Supreme Leader: ReportAccording to the top officials, Israel informed the US of an opportunity to assassinate Iran's Supreme Leader but Trump vetoed the plan.

Israeli trekker, missing for 10 days in Himachal, found alive with fractured legAn Israeli trekker, identified as Samuel Vengrinovich, missing for 10 days in Himachal's Triund area, has been found alive in the forest with a fractured leg after surviving on grass and forest fruits.

Filmmaker missing after Air India crash, wife's agonising search continuesAccording to Mahesh Kalawadia's wife, the police informed her that his phone was located 700 meters from the crash site and went off a minute before the flight took off.

Why Virat Kohli did not speak to AB de Villiers for months? Legend revealsAB de Villiers revealed Virat Kohli stopped speaking to him after he leaked the news about Anushka being pregnant with the latter's second child.

India, European Union committed to free trade agreement by year-end: PM in CyprusPM Narendra Modi kicked off his Cyprus visit with a strong pitch for economic ties, highlighting India's digital rise. He said that India and the European Union are committed to a free trade agreement by the end of this year.

Hyderabad-bound Lufthansa flight returns to Frankfurt mid-air after bomb threatA Lufthansa Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner flight bound for Hyderabad returned to Frankfurt halfway into the journey due to a suspected bomb threat.

sports.headline: England to beat India 3-2: Dale Steyn makes bold prediction ahead of Test seriesFormer South African fast-bowling great Dale Steyn has predicted that each match in the upcoming five-Test series will be closely contested, yet produce a definitive result. Steyn believes England will beat India to clinch the series 3-2.

Who's taken Rohit Sharma's seat on the team bus? Kuldeep Yadav revealsStar India spinner Kuldeep Yadav has revealed who's taken Rohit Sharma's place on the Indian team bus. Rohit Sharma recently announced his retirement from Tests ahead of the series against England.

India's intra-squad match called off after Shardul hits 122 vs Bumrah, SirajShardul Thakur made a case for his inclusion in India's playing XI for the first Test against England after starring with both bat and ball in India A's intra-squad match. His performance intensifies the race for the all-rounder spot ahead of the England Test series.

Mitchell Johnson questions Josh Hazlewood for prioritising IPL after WTC final lossFormer Australia fast bowler Mitchell Johnson has questioned Josh Hazlewood for prioritising the Indian Premier League (IPL) ahead of national commitments after loss in the WTC final.

PSG thrash Atletico Madrid, Bayern Munich demolish Auckland CityParis Saint-Germain crushed Atletico Madrid 4-0 in their march toward global domination at the FIFA Club World Cup on Sunday, while Bayern Munich showed no mercy to Auckland's amateurs, delivering a ruthless 10-0 thrashing.

Pole vaulter Mondo Duplantis breaks world record for 12th time, first time at homePaul Vaulter Mondo Duplantis broke the world record for a whopping 12th time in his career at the Wanda Diamond League meeting in Stockholm. The 25-year-old was thrilled to have achieved the feat for the first time on home soil at the historic 1912 Olympic Stadium.

Canadian Grand Prix: George Russell wins from pole as Piastri and Norris collideGeorge Russell handed Mercedes its first win of the Formula One season with a composed drive at the Canadian Grand Prix on Sunday. The race also saw a major shift in the championship standings, as McLaren's Oscar Piastri moved 22 points clear at the top after teammate Lando Norris collided with him and was forced to retire.

Lewis, Hosein annihilate Ireland in 3rd T20I, set up 1-0 series win for WIWest Indies beat Ireland by 62 runs in the third T20I and won the series by 1-0 after the first two matches were washed out due to rain. Evin Lewis was adjudged Player of the Match for his innings of 91 (44).

Rugby Premier League: Bengaluru-Delhi split points in opening dayThe inaugural season of the Rugby Premier League kicked off with exciting matches and a grand opening ceremony. The event brought together top players, celebrities, and dignitaries, signalling a new era for rugby in India.

Gennaro Gattuso replaces Luciano Spalletti as Italy national team coachGennaro Gattuso has been appointed head coach of the Italy national football team. His leadership comes at a crucial time as Italy aims to qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup.

No Nicholas Pooran, no problem: West Indies slam 256 runs in T20I vs IrelandEvin Lewis and Shai Hope's brilliant partnership helped West Indies reach 256 against Ireland the 3rd T20I of their series. Windies would hope to move on from Nicholas Pooran, who recently called time on his international career.

Canadian Grand Prix: George Russell wins from pole as Piastri and Norris collideGeorge Russell handed Mercedes its first win of the Formula One season with a composed drive at the Canadian Grand Prix on Sunday. The race also saw a major shift in the championship standings, as McLaren's Oscar Piastri moved 22 points clear at the top after teammate Lando Norris collided with him and was forced to retire.

Lewis, Hosein annihilate Ireland in 3rd T20I, set up 1-0 series win for WIWest Indies beat Ireland by 62 runs in the third T20I and won the series by 1-0 after the first two matches were washed out due to rain. Evin Lewis was adjudged Player of the Match for his innings of 91 (44).

Rugby Premier League: Bengaluru-Delhi split points in opening dayThe inaugural season of the Rugby Premier League kicked off with exciting matches and a grand opening ceremony. The event brought together top players, celebrities, and dignitaries, signalling a new era for rugby in India.

Gennaro Gattuso replaces Luciano Spalletti as Italy national team coachGennaro Gattuso has been appointed head coach of the Italy national football team. His leadership comes at a crucial time as Italy aims to qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup.

No Nicholas Pooran, no problem: West Indies slam 256 runs in T20I vs IrelandEvin Lewis and Shai Hope's brilliant partnership helped West Indies reach 256 against Ireland the 3rd T20I of their series. Windies would hope to move on from Nicholas Pooran, who recently called time on his international career.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
